duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and communicate a clear vision and strategy for the engineering department that aligns with the company's overall goals and objectives.
Lead the recruitment, onboarding, and development of engineering talent, ensuring the team's skillset matches the company's needs.
Ensure that engineering activities and processes comply with all relevant health, safety, and environmental regulations and standards.
Oversee the planning, execution, and successful delivery of all engineering projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.
Champion technological innovation and research, staying up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to guide the team's decision-making process.
Identify skill gaps within the engineering team and implement training programs to enhance the technical competencies and professional development of engineers and technicians.
Collaborate closely with other department heads to ensure effective communication and alignment across teams.
Develop and present capital expenditure proposals for new equipment, machinery, and technology upgrades that will enhance manufacturing capabilities and improve productivity.
Identify potential risks and challenges associated with engineering projects and develop mitigation strategies to address them.
Develop and manage the engineering department's budget, allocating resources efficiently to meet project requirements and organizational goals.
Collaborate with the innovation and development team to translate new product designs and concepts into manufacturable solutions, ensuring the smooth transition from design to production.
Identify opportunities for process optimization, automation, and lean manufacturing practices to enhance production efficiency and reduce costs.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering.
